newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dull German shares lose ground in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Dull German shares lose ground in late trade.

text.p: German shares eased on Wednesday afternoon as the dollar dropped off the day's highs, taking stocks down in its wake.
The IBIS DAX index was down 4.88 points at 4,320.98 points at 1345 GMT, having closed the bourse session at mid-afternoon at 4,335.39 points.
September DTB DAX futures were down 10 points at 4,343 points.
The dollar, which had boosted share prices earlier as it briefly breached an eight-year high of 1.89 marks, was trading around 1.88 marks in the late afternoon.
Dealers said there was still no clear trend on the market. Uncertainties about the Bundesbank's interest rate strategy were still undermining market activity.
Moreover, Wall Street shares eased at their opening, further unsettling German traders.
Activity was focused on individual shares, such as utility Veba AG, up 2.30 marks at 110.40 marks ahead of its interim report which is due on Thursday.
